item.title: Deltascaoe ::pickup
item.dc:creator: @legend-scape legend-scape
item.description:
@legend-scape wrote:

[quote=“chassy13, post:3, topic:249191”]if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights >= 0) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if(args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sM("No such item."); } } else { sM("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100"); } } }

ty mate =][/quote]

item.title: Deltascaoe ::pickup
item.dc:creator: @firewithin3 firewithin3
item.description:
@firewithin3 wrote:

[quote=“chassy13, post:6, topic:249191”]I just gave you the code, this is 1st grade math.

= is equal?

is greater than

playerRights >= 0

playerRights GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO 0[/quote]= is actually the assignment operator which assigns a value to a datatype, == is the equals operator to check if the datatype or parameter equals what you’re making it check.

I just gave you the code, this is 1st grade math.

= is equal?

is greater than

playerRights GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO 0

Edit: Or you can do what firewithin said, it does not matter. Try before making a topic. -.-

item.title: Deltascaoe ::pickup
item.dc:creator: @firewithin3 firewithin3
item.description:
@firewithin3 wrote:

Wow, you’re still asking stupid questions. I really don’t see why you have coding forums when you can’t understand how simple shit like this works. I’m going to give you the EXACT code so you can leech it, because that’s how good a coder you are.

if (command.startsWith("pickup")) {
              String[] args = command.split(" ");
            if(args.length == 3) {
         int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
         int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
         if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) {
            addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
         } else {
            sM("No such item.");
         }
      } else {
         sM("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100");
      }
       }
}

All you do is remove the playerRights parameter from the if statement…

OR you could do it this way:

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights > -1) {
              String[] args = command.split(" ");
            if(args.length == 3) {
         int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
         int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
         if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) {
            addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount);
         } else {
            sM("No such item.");
         }
      } else {
         sM("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100");
      }
       }
}

Read full topic

item.title: Deltascaoe ::pickup
item.dc:creator: @legend-scape legend-scape
item.description:
@legend-scape wrote:

Ok since everyone hates deltascape im going to make it so normal players can use ::pickup so how can i do that becuz its allready like this, which is on 0, which is for normal player’s.?

here is the command i have,…

if (command.startsWith("pickup") && playerRights > 0) { String[] args = command.split(" "); if(args.length == 3) { int newItemID = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); int newItemAmount = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); if (newItemID <= 160000 && newItemID >= 0) { addItem(newItemID, newItemAmount); } else { sM("No such item."); } } else { sM("Oops! Use as ::pickup 995 100"); } } }
